ext_descriptions.ext_description: The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS. A Bare_die is a type of a . A Bare_die is used to describe the physical shape and function of a semiconductor device. In the PCA domain an occurrence of a Bare_die may be installed into an occurrence of a to realize a , an occurrence of which is then mounted in the assembly. In this role of performing a function, a Bare_die has terminals. In the PCB domain an occurrence of a Bare_die may be installed into the design of an to realize an embedded component. In this role, the external surfaces of the Bare_die will be important as they form part of the location information for the occurrence. A Bare_die implements electrical functionality. It is not necessary to exchange Bare_die information for parts such as molded or ceramic resistors where there is not a separately identifiable and common industry understanding of a die. In the PCA domain an occurrence of a Bare_die may be mounted directly onto the occurrence of a usage view of a PCB. The existence of oxide or other thin contaminate protection is considered normal for a Bare_die.

the die_seating_plane is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Bare_die is dependent on the existence of the that is also a standard orientation reference for assembly purposes for the Bare_die. The is simulating a mounting surface.

the access_mechanisms is an inverse relationship that specifies that the existence of the Bare_die is dependent on the existence of the that specifies the Bare_die as its associated_definition. There shall be two or more for a Bare_die.
the implemented_function specifies the role of the for the Bare_die.

the maximum_material_condition_centroid_location specifies one role of the for the Bare_die. The maximum_material_condition_centroid_location is the center of mass for a bare die in the state that contains the most material. The maximum_material_condition_centroid_location need not be specified for a particular Bare_die.

the least_material_condition_centroid_location specifies one role of the for the Bare_die. The least_material_condition_centroid_location is the center of mass for a bare die in the minimum material state. The least_material_condition_centroid_location need not be specified for a particular Bare_die.
A Bare_die_bottom_surface is a type of .
A Bare_die_edge_segment_surface is a type of .
A Bare_die_edge_surface is a type of .
A Bare_die_surface is a type of . A Bare_die_surface is one of a , a , a , or a .
the associated_definition specifies the role of the for the .

The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS. A Bare_die_terminal is a type of . A Bare_die_terminal is the surface area on a that corresponds to the functional terminal on that Bare_die. A device_terminal_map in combination with a part_device_terminal are populated to map the functionality of a Bare_die to the functionality of the packaged_part for the occurrence of the Bare_die in the Packaged_part.

ext_description.p: the external_connection_area specifies the of the Bare_die_terminal. The external_connection_area is the area on the surface of a to which an electrically conducting material shall be attached to access the electrical functionality of the . There may be more than one Connection_zone for a Bare_die_terminal. The external_connection_area is optional and need not be supplied if the data is unavailable in the source system. If the data is available in the source system, it shall be supplied. <!--Eco2--> The inherited by the terminal may be the same Feature_shape_occurrence that is specified by the associated . In this case the whole terminal is the Connection_zone. <!--/Eco2-->

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the material specifies the role of the for the Bare_die_terminal.

A Bare_die_top_surface is a type of .
A Guided_wave_bare_die_terminal is a type of used with guided waves in high frequency or fiber-optic applications.

A Minimally_defined_bare_die_terminal is a type of . A Minimally_defined_bare_die_terminal may be a or additionally may be a . The associated_definition specifies the to which the provides electrical access. A Minimally_defined_bare_die_terminal does not include location or shape information.
the associated_definition specifies the role of the for the Minimally_defined_bare_die_terminal.
